oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Death portrait of an African American child, 1860s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hand tinted death portrait of an African American child. The child is propped up with pillows and blankets and is wearing a dress. Typewritten description underneath reads "Post Mortum image of early 1860's BLACK slave child." Reverse is inscribed with "From A. BROWN'S/ Photography & Gem GALLERY,/ Cor. Main and Union Avenue,/MEMPHIS, Tenn."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Portrait photographs; Postmortem photographs; African Americans; Children; Child slaves--Tennessee--Memphis
Memphis (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: A. Brown's Photograph & Gem Gallery (photographer)
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
